title: Poland's great economic catch-up, 20 years after accession to the European Union
summary: Despite a certain amount of Euroscepticism in politics and some people being left behind, the country has recovered thanks to European funds and the single market. However, the next two decades are likely to be more difficult.

title: New Caledonia: Emmanuel Macron's ultimatum strategy
summary: As with the pension reform and the immigration law, the head of state uses the same approach in the New Caledonian issue: control the schedule and set a negotiation deadline. While effective in business, this tactic creates distrust and divisions in politics.

title: UN halts all food distribution in Rafah due to lack of supplies
summary: The main United Nations agency for Palestinian refugees, UNRWA, announced on Tuesday the suspension of distribution in Rafah in a post on X without elaborating.

title: Israel to return video equipment seized from Associated Press
summary: Israel reversed its decision to shut down an Associated Press live video feed from war-torn Gaza on Tuesday, after protests from the US news agency and concerns from the White House.

title: After the death of the Iranian president, Tehran faces a double challenge
summary: The Islamic Republic must put forward a possible replacement for Ebrahim Raisi in the elections scheduled for June 28 and also assess options for the succession of the 85-year-old Supreme Leader since the late president was in contention.

title: Cannes 2024: David Cronenberg's 'The Shrouds' explores life and death
summary: At 81, the Canadian director created a film of ethereal beauty, where the protagonist (Vincent Cassel) follows the day-by-day decomposition of his wife's body.

title: Macron will make surprise visit to New Caledonia amid riots
summary: A government spokeswoman announced that the French president will leave on Tuesday evening in an attempt to soothe raging tempers and protests in the French territory.

title: Gérard Depardieu reportedly involved in physical altercation with photographer
summary: According to Italian media, well-known Italian paparazzi photographer Rino Barillari accused the French film star of punching him three times in the face when he tried to photograph him.

title: Cannes 2024: 'The Apprentice,' the rise of Donald Trump from the deriding gaze of Ali Abbasi
summary: The Danish filmmaker returns to the beginnings of the former US president's career, drawing a portrait of a tycoon in the making, caught up in the world of reality TV.

title: Israel-Hamas war: ICC prosecutor requests arrest warrants for both Netanyahu and Hamas leaders
summary: In Israel, the International Criminal Court's decision to equate its government with the Islamist movement provoked strong condemnation, while the Palestinians saw it as recognition of the suffering of the people of Gaza.

title: 'Restricting TikTok in New Caledonia cannot be deemed necessary or proportionate'
summary: Stefania Di Stefano, a specialist in international law, warns of the weak legal basis for blocking the mobile app in the archipelago. This measure is 'unprecedented in France.'

title: Welcome to the Australian outback, the land of Mad Max
summary: For 'Furiosa,' the fifth installment screened out of competition at Cannes, George Miller returned to Silverton, a former mining town turned pilgrimage site for fans after it was the location for the second film in the Mad Max franchise.

title: Pixar lays off 14% of its staff to 'focus on feature films'
summary: The Disney-owned studio is reportedly retreating from making content for streaming following the catastrophic releases of 'Lightyear' and 'Elemental.'

title: China slams Lai's inauguration speech and warns Taiwan of reprisals
summary: China on Tuesday called the inauguration speech of Taiwan's new president Lai Ching-te a 'confession of Taiwan independence,' and warned it would take 'countermeasures.'

title: EU and Moldova sign 'security and defense' partnership
summary: The European Union said similar agreements with other 'selected partners' were also currently in the works.

title: Climate change victims file suit against TotalEnergies and its shareholders
summary: Three days before the group's AGM, eight individuals and three associations are suing the oil giant for 'involuntary manslaughter' and 'endangering others.'

title: One dead, 71 injured after London-Singapore flight hits severe turbulence
summary: The plane apparently plummeted for a number of minutes before it was diverted to Bangkok, where emergency crews rushed to help injured passengers amid stormy weather.

title: Spain 'definitively' recalls ambassador to Argentina after Milei calls Sanchez's wife 'corrupt'
summary: The Argentinian president refused to apologize after labelling the Spanish prime minister's wife as 'corrupt' at a conference in Spain last weekend.

title: Greek court acquits nine Egyptians accused of involvement in fatal shipwreck
summary: The defendants were on board the trawler 'Adriana,' which sank with over 700 passengers off Pylos in June 2023. Only around 100 survived.

title: New Caledonia riots: 'Republican order has not been restored,' say loyalists
summary: At a press conference in Nouméa, the leaders of New Caledonia's right-wing party denounced the violence committed by the pro-independence camp and insisted that the time for an agreement had not yet come.

title: EU elections: Bernard Guetta, the Macron camp's left-wing guarantor
summary: The former France Inter journalist, now the presidential majority candidate for the June 9 election, aims to prevent social-democratic voters from defecting to Raphaël Glucksmann, the Parti Socialiste's lead candidate.

title: Twelve days of hell on the front in Ukraine
summary: Wounded and surrounded in the Donbas, two soldiers from an infantry unit, 'the Biker' and 'the Restless One,'  recount their long and perilous evacuation from the front line.

title: EU: Environmental NGOs struggle against lobbyists to defend electronic device sustainability
summary: In negotiations surrounding crucial texts like the ecodesign directive, battery regulation and the right to repair, environmental organizations struggle due to insufficient resources and the complex workings of the institutions.

title: French president flies to riot-struck New Caledonia
summary: President Macron has flown to New Caledonia amid the deadliest unrest in four decades blamed on French plans to give voting rights to thousands of non-indigenous residents.

title: European elections: Le Pen officially breaks with German ally AfD
summary: After the German far-right party's lead candidate made revisionist remarks in an interview, Marine Le Pen made it clear that her party would not sit in the same group as AfD members in the European Parliament.

title: Norway, Ireland, Spain to recognize Palestinian state
summary: After more than seven months of war between Israel and Hamas, Norway, Ireland and Spain have announced that they will recognize a Palestinian state.

title: Ireland, Norway and Spain decide to jointly recognize Palestine as a state
summary: The countries' announcements are a further setback for Israel, 12 days after the United Nations General Assembly passed a resolution calling for Palestine to become a full member state of the UN. Israel reacted by recalling its ambassadors.

title: New Caledonia: Macron wants to regain control with surprise visit
summary: The French president took off for Nouméa on Tuesday evening, eight days after the start of riots in the archipelago. The city is still the scene of localized clashes.

title: Macron wants to make France a 'champion' in AI
summary: On Tuesday, France's president announced a number of measures aimed at spreading the use of artificial intelligence. Paris plans to host an international summit in February 2025.

title: In Kinmen's disputed waters, the Chinese coast guard tests Taiwan's limits
summary: Taiwan's Kinmen islands, situated less than four kilometers from mainland China, are the epicenter of growing tensions between the two shores of the Strait.

title: Germany's AfD bans scandal-hit lead candidate from EU election events
summary: Germany's far-right AfD party has banned its leading candidate Maximilian Krah from EU election campaign events. Krah is being investigated for suspicious links to Russia and China.

title: Which countries officially recognize a State of Palestine?
summary: With Ireland, Norway and Spain announcing on Wednesday that they were preparing to officially recognize a Palestinian state, we take a look back at Palestine's journey to statehood.

title: How is the violent unrest in New Caledonia impacting global nickel prices?
summary: Global nickel prices have skyrocketed since deadly violence erupted last week in the French territory that holds between 20-30% of the world's nickel reserves.

title: Ukraine under threat of new front in Sumy region
summary: By carrying out an offensive in the Kharkiv region and concentrating troops near Sumy, Moscow wants to force Kyiv to stretch its battle lines, potentially compromising its other positions.

title: Not right moment for France to recognize Palestinian state, says foreign minister
summary: French Foreign Minister Stéphane Séjourné said that it was not 'taboo' to recognize a Palestinian state, but Paris considers that now is not the right moment for it to do so.

title: Pentagon says Russia launched 'likely' space weapon in path of US satellite
summary: The Russian 'counter-space weapon' launched on May 16 was deployed 'into the same orbit as a US government satellite,' a Pentagon spokesperson said on Tuesday.

title: Novo Nordisk: Large fire breaks out at Danish pharma giant's offices
summary: Copenhagen's fire service said a 'massive' fire had broken out in an office building belonging to the maker of the weight loss drugs Ozempic and Wegovy.

title: 20 people still in intensive care after turbulent Singapore Airlines flight
summary: Singapore Airlines flight SQ321 hit 'sudden extreme turbulence' over Myanmar 10 hours into its journey to Singapore on Tuesday. One person died during the terrifying high-altitude plunge.

title: Trump deletes 'unified reich' video after backlash and Biden attacks
summary: The video shared on Donald Trump's Truth Social account showed fictional newspaper headlines celebrating his victory, including one making a reference to Nazi Germany.

title: Gaza: 'If Israel is incapable of proposing a transition, it is because it is categorically opposed to imagining a day after'
summary: Since the last peace negotiations between Israelis and Palestinians over 10 years ago, everyone has resigned themselves to giving the Israelis a free hand. The results are visible today, analyzes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: France pays tribute to slain prison officers, with attackers still at large
summary: The guards were killed in an attack at a highway toll booth by gunmen who freed the convict they were transporting, Mohamed Amra.

title: Red hands at Paris Shoah Memorial: Investigation points to foreign interference
summary: Investigations have led to the identification of three perpetrators, who made their travel arrangements from Bulgaria. The modus operandi is similar to when Stars of David were spray-painted in Paris, in what the French government described as a case of Russian interference.

title: New Caledonia: Cyberattack denounced by authorities is not quite 'unprecedented'
summary: Internet access was briefly disrupted on Tuesday night in the archipelago. The exact details of the cyberattack denounced by the local authorities are still unclear.

title: Rishi Sunak calls UK general election for July 4
summary: The vote could see the Labour Party, sidelined from power since 2010, win Parliament and designate the successor to the current Conservative leader, in office since October 2022.

title: Why is New Caledonia's electoral reform sparking riots?
summary: The French territory in the Pacific Ocean is experiencing its most serious tensions since the 1980s due to a new reform of the electoral body. Le Monde explains what's at stake.

title: Kirill Serebrennikov delivers incomplete portrayal of Eduard Limonov at Cannes Film Festival
summary: Adapted from Emmanuel Carrère's book, 'Limonov: The Ballad' struggles to capture the complex personality of the Russian writer and dissident, whose most embarrassing positions are ignored by the filmmaker.

title: French greenhouse gas emissions fell 5.8% in 2023
summary: France's climate change monitoring association Citepa had predicted in March a yearly fall of 4.8%. Despite the government's bullishness, several environmental groups have claimed such drops are largely cyclical.

title: Atalanta win Europa League beating Bayer Leverkusen 3-0
summary: Ademola Lookman scored a stunning hat-trick as Atalanta ended Bayer Leverkusen's 51-match unbeaten run to win the Europa League final 3-0 on Wednesday.
